title: Bobby Jacobs
text:
Bobby Jacobs (born 1965) is a Dutch bassist, songwriter and producer best known as the former bassist for the Dutch <a href="Rock%20music">rock</a> band <a href="Focus%20%28band%29">Focus</a>, from 2002 to December 2016.
Biography.
Jacobs was born in <a href="Hilversum">Hilversum</a>, <a href="Netherlands">Netherlands</a>. He is the second son of famed Dutch musician <a href="Ruud%20Jacobs">Ruud Jacobs</a> and therefore the nephew of <a href="Pim%20Jacobs">Pim Jacobs</a>. Jacobs has two brothers, Jeroen and Roeland, and is the stepson of <a href="Thijs%20van%20Leer">Thijs van Leer</a>, the founding member of Focus. Jacobs was a member of van Leer's side bands Van Leer and Conxi, and Olivia.
From 2002 to December 2016, Jacobs was a member of Focus as their bassist as is featured on their studio albums "<a href="Focus%208">Focus 8</a>" (2002), "<a href="Focus%209%20/%20New%20Skin">Focus 9 / New Skin</a>" (2009), "<a href="Focus%20X">Focus X</a>" (2012), and "<a href="Golden%20Oldies%20%28album%29">Golden Oldies</a>" (2014). During his tenure with the band, Jacobs also served as their producer and was credited as a writer on "De Ti O De Me", "Sylvia's Stepson", "Aya-Yuppie-Hippy-Yee" and "Hoeratio". He was replaced by Dutch player Udo Pannekeet.
